Mini 1365: Generic Village Mafia


The sleepy village of Aifam awoke to find their beloved mayor sprawled in the town square, poison pooling from a tipped vial beside him. Thirteen of the most outspoken village citizens gathered in a temporary council, lynching ropes in hand, to determine who was responsible for his death.

The Survivors (4/13)
1. snifit Paschendale
2. Hoopla Toro
3. uctriton00
4. AngryPidgeon

* indicates a prod.

Dead (9/13)
Spoiler:
Guttersnipe, Town Miller, lynched Day 1
Masnev, Vanilla Townie, killed Night 1
image, Vanilla Townie, killed Night 1
fatlikepig, Vanilla Townie, lynched Day 2
theplague42, Mafia Rolecop, killed Night 2
TeChNoWC, 2-Shot Vigilante, killed Night 2
Shamrock, Mafia Goon, lynched Day 3
CooLDoG, Town Cop, killed Night 3
ChaosOmega, Mafia Goon, lynched Day 4

Rules


General
  • Keep your interactions with other players respectful and follow all site rules and guidelines.
  • Unless your role PM specifically states you are allowed to, you may not discuss this game outside of this thread.
  • You may not directly quote any private communications (such as role PMs or QuickTopics) in this thread.
  • Do not try to obscure any text in your post by making it an illegibly small size or color.
  • This is my color. Don't use it.
  • Do not edit your posts.
  • Play to your win condition.
  • If you need to ask me something, bold it to make sure I don't miss it.

Votes, Lynches, and Death
  • All votes must be written in bold or by using the vote tags, like Vote: triangle123 or VOTE: triangle123. You may also vote for a no-lynch in this manner.
  • A lynch or decision to have no lynch will occur when simple majority is reached.
  • If no majority is reached by the deadline, that day will end with no lynch.
  • You may use abbreviations of usernames when you vote for someone so long as it is clear who the person in question is.
  • Discussion may persist during the twilight phase.

Deadlines and Activity
  • Every game day will have a deadline of 14 real life days. Extensions will be granted under my discretion.
  • Every game night will have a deadline of 72 hours for night action submission.
  • You will receive a prod if you do not post for 72 hours, at which point you will have 48 hours to post in the thread.
  • If a player receives more than three prods in one game day, he or she will be replaced. I may also replace players at my own discretion.

This is a normal game. As such, the flavor bears no significance on game play. A sample Vanilla Townie role PM is enclosed:

You are a Vanilla Townie. Your only power is your vote. You win if all threats to the town have been eliminated and there is at least one town member remaining alive. Please confirm by replying with your role name.
Role PMs are now being sent out. The day will begin when 10 out of 13 players have confirmed, or 48 hours have passed, whichever occurs first.

Day 1

Another standout was his #111, which is weird and scummy, in the way he defends his vote on UTC as being a pressure vote and fencesits nicely on UTC's alignment. Just seems like flimsy posturing.

I don't know enough about CooLDoG, because I haven't played with him in a long time, but I got the distinct impression when I was reading the game he was very reactive and very eager to cooperate with people when they were questioning - people should be doing their best to cooperate, but it looked like he was stepping on eggshells and trying not to offend or be called out. I kinda think he'd be a bit more laid back and aggressive as town.

I might be wifom'ing myself, but his reaction to theplague's claim looked good, because it carried an air of suspicion about it, which I like. He didn't just accept it, and didn't automatically think it scummy - I think in those situations where the game can change rapidly, scum will either make a definitive read or be super fence-sitty. The trying to get another Doc to counterclaim was a proactive town action, I think.

~~

I'm a sucker for premature VT claims, especially ones out of nowhere. It's annoying when it happens because it narrows down the PR pool, but it really is only newb-town players that make this play. Newb-scum tend to like keeping their options open rather than committing to something untruthful for the sake of it - as a general rule, it's much easier to tell the truth, and there needs to be some reason to fabricate a lie unnecessarily, and this instance, for scum to fakeclaim VT, they need a reason to do it - and most newb-scum won't be savvy enough with this site's meta to realise it looks really town (which is the only reason to do it as scum), whereas town will often leak this information out of boredom or not realising the consequences of what they're doing. It's so much easier to tell the truth than to lie, and I think I've seen enough of UTC to say he has little idea what he's doing, which makes the tell much more reliable to me.

~~

Masnev staggered down the quiet street, his cheeks ruddy beneath the artificial lights. He swung his whiskey bottle by the neck as he stumbled his way through an old Irish tune, even while alley cats yowled in distress at his utter lack of pitch.

A hand gripped his shoulder. The streetlights flickered out.

Masnev inhaled sharply. Then -

Silence.

Masnev was a Vanilla Townie.

Image leaned back in his chair, blearily staring at the screen of his monitor. A framed photo of his wife and six-year-old son sat next to it, and he smiled at it. His eyes drifted to his watch, and he sighed. They'd both be asleep this late at night, making this another day he wouldn't get to see his family.

Stretching his arms above his head, he began to stand up, and then froze. A blade flashed before him, resting just above his throat, and soft breathing on his neck sent chills down his spine. Image's lips stretched into a scream of horror.

When his body crumpled to the ground, it was almost like his lips were still moving - but no sound came out.

Image was a Vanilla Townie.
